channel.title: Help me choose a new monitor
channel.description:
So my CRT just kind of died on me.
I'm looking at new flatscreens, I heard Dell's got some good prices. I'm looking at the 21-23" range, 1920x1080 or 1920x1200. $200 is about the upper limit.
Is 5ms a decent response time for gaming and movies? [url]https://accessories.us.dell.com/sna/products/Displays/productdetail.aspx?c=us&l=en&s=dhs&cs=19&sku=320-0921[/url] [url]https://accessories.us.dell.com/sna/products/Displays/productdetail.aspx?c=us&l=en&s=dhs&cs=19&sku=320-8299[/url]
were the two that I was looking at. Are these decent monitors? Do you have any other suggestions?

item.title: Help me choose a new monitor
item.dc:creator: Jingles
item.description:
Bloody hell that is good or bloody hell that is a rip off?

EDIT: That should be 1440 x 900

Read full topic

Look on ebay, my brother got a 19" 1600x1200 acer monitor for £20 and I got a 17" one with speaks for £15

Bloody Hell.

item.title: Help me choose a new monitor
item.dc:creator: deFRAGer
item.description:
One of my friends brought a BenQ G2220HD, its full HD and is 21.5 inches. It is pretty cheap to.

https://www.devhardware.com/c/a/Flat-Panel-Reviews/BenQ-G2220HD/
https://www.pcadvisor.co.uk/reviews/index.cfm?reviewid=115397

I have a 5ms response time View-sonic 19 inch, and I notice no ghosting, I play and watch a lot of games, so it should be fine.

Read full topic
item.source: Help me choose a new monitor

So my CRT just kind of died on me.

I’m looking at new flatscreens, I heard Dell’s got some good prices. I’m looking at the 21-23" range, 1920x1080 or 1920x1200. $200 is about the upper limit.
